tags: brought to u by ur local ex-barista and current coffee snob
summary: coffee headcanons for modern au starks
title: coffee headcanons for modern au starks
body:
• ned: his ideal morning is sitting by the kitchen window sipping on a nice cup of coffee with just a dash of cream and sugar before the rest of the house wakes up. once the kids start to stir, it’s time to chug the coffee and face the day.
  • catelyn: you know that one post about the woman who went into a starbucks and ordered a venti pumpkin spice latte with eight shots of espresso, and when the barista asked if she was sure, the woman looked them dead in the eyes and said “i have five kids”. that woman was catelyn tully. someone help her. she’s so tired. she doesn’t even like coffee.
  • robb: he gets up in the mornings and is awake right away. just like that, no coffee necessary. he doesn’t mind the taste but he doesn’t need it to wake up. do not trust this man, he’s not human.
  • jon: he’s not a hipster, he swears. he just has opinions on different coffee roasts, and the different strains of the coffee plant, and shut up robb, you can really taste the difference okay! his go to drink is an iced red eye.
  • sansa: a nice cappuccino with of course, a side of lemon cake. she’s a classy lady. she also has at least four pictures on her instagram of cappuccinos. she’s got a very good eye for lighting, her instagram might be a tad basic but it is very #aesthetic.
  • arya: *john mulaney voice* one black coffee. iced usually, regardless of the weather. she’s not super picky about the quality. it all tastes the same, right? (shut up jon.)
  • bran: prefers tea. loose leaf green tea with some honey if possible. cat got him hooked on tea when he was in recovery after his accident and she was doing all this research on how diet affects healing and stumbled across some article on health benefits of different teas. bran just thinks it tastes good.
  • rickon: this boy will ask for a venti mocha frappuccino (extra shot, extra whip) and under no circumstances is he allowed to have it. rickon on caffeine is not something you want to witness in this life or in the next

tags: i really want an arya and weasel reunion
a song of ice and fire
summary: “Arya had eaten a bug once when she was little, just to make Sansa screech, so she hadn’t been afraid to eat another. Weasel...
body:
“Arya had eaten a bug once when she was little, just to make Sansa screech, so she hadn’t been afraid to eat another. Weasel wasn’t either, but Hot Pie retched up the beetle he tried to swallow, and Lommy and Gendry wouldn’t even try.”

-ACOK, Arya V

summary: Arya has had a few moments throughout the show where she’s been at a crossroads and could have made a decision that would have...
body:
Arya has had a few moments throughout the show where she’s been at a crossroads and could have made a decision that would have been positive or negative to the outcome of her story.

Season 4

After the Hound “died” Arya had the option of searching for her missing family, or going to Braavos to train at the House of Black and White. She chose to go to Braavos and learned many skills while there, but suffered great hardship, trauma and abuse.

Season 6

After Arya realized being an assassin wouldn’t work out and she didn’t have the constitution to kill people for money, she had the option of going ‘West of Westeros’ to travel and explore, or going home. She ended up telling Jaqen “ A Girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and I’m going home.” That was a positive development for her, meant to show she was growing as a character and slowly healing from her trauma. She was redirecting the downhill trajectory of her life.

Season 7

Arya was working on finishing her list and avenging her family. She had just killed the Freys and had decided to go to King’s Landing to kill Cersei until Hot Pie told her Jon was back in Winterfell. Arya had to option of continuing her path of bloodshed and solitude or reuniting with her family. She chose to go home to Winterfell, an incredibly powerful and emotional moment the audience cheered for, because she chose life and her family over death and loneliness.

Season 8

Now Arya has a choice between reverting back to her path of isolation and seclusion, or moving forward and choosing life, love and family. She has rejected Gendry so she could go and kill Cersei, but the season isn’t over yet. Going off Arya’s journey in the previous seasons it’s very obvious to me that Arya choosing to be alone would be the tragedy, and her choosing to be with Gendry would be her happy ending. And given the outcome of her past dilemmas, isn’t it obvious what decision she’ll make? “What do we say to the God of Death?” “Not Today.” Arya Stark will always choose LIFE. That is her journey. Fuck you, Death. I’m going to LIVE.

blog.name: atimefordirewolves
blog.title: "Have a biscuit, Potter"
blog.description: Sarah, 23, UK, Hufflepuff // I love Arya, Gendry, Theon, Dany, and Ginny Weasley with my whole moronic heart // #atimefordirewolves

summary: Do you think the hound will help arya and gendry reunite after KL?
question: Do you think the hound will help arya and gendry reunite after KL?
answer: Yes. But I’m not sure the extent to which he’ll be instrumental. I think he’ll have words that imply it - I mean, he pretty bluntly told Gendry to go and find Arya, and figured pretty fast Gendry loves her. And he’s known them since they were children, and loved each other in a way they couldn’t fully comprehend. I just think the placement of Sandor alongside them this season has been too prominent for it to not mean anything, but we’ll see.

reblog.comment: Yes. But I’m not sure the extent to which he’ll be instrumental. I think he’ll have words that imply it - I mean, he pretty bluntly told Gendry to go and find Arya, and figured pretty fast Gendry loves her. And he’s known them since they were children, and loved each other in a way they couldn’t fully comprehend. I just think the placement of Sandor alongside them this season has been too prominent for it to not mean anything, but we’ll see.

I think he’ll have words that imply it - I mean, he pretty bluntly told Gendry to go and find Arya, and figured pretty fast Gendry loves her. And he’s known them since they were children, and loved each other in a way they couldn’t fully comprehend. I just think the placement of Sandor alongside them this season has been too prominent for it to not mean anything, but we’ll see.

I think he’ll have words that imply it - I mean, he pretty bluntly told Gendry to go and find Arya, and figured pretty fast Gendry loves her. And he’s known them since they were children, and loved each other in a way they couldn’t fully comprehend. I just think the placement of Sandor alongside them this season has been too prominent for it to not mean anything, but we’ll see.

blog.name: sumoflam
blog.title: Sumoflam's Story Shots
blog.description: Every picture tells a story.  Those who follow my many blogs and trip journals know that I take hundreds of photos.  Unlike my travel blogs, the intent of this blog is to highlight some of my more “artsy” and/or “unique” photos from around the US and Canada.  There won’t be any huge buffaloes or twine balls or strange restaurants.  Rather, I intend to show the beauty and interest of places.  I hope you enjoy this diversion.  Watch soon for photos…one post at a time.

WARNING:  MAJOR SPOILERS TO FOLLOW.  READ AT YOUR OWN RISK

Daenerys Targaryen lost a second dragon last week in Game of Thrones and is overwhelmed by the death of her loved advisor Missandei. Jon Snow and his forces face a major challenge getting past Euron Greyjoy’s ballisti, the giant dragon-killing and boat-crushing crossbows.  They are at odds and the end of the Starks may be coming. blog.name: atimefordirewolves
blog.title: "Have a biscuit, Potter"
blog.description: Sarah, 23, UK, Hufflepuff // I love Arya, Gendry, Theon, Dany, and Ginny Weasley with my whole moronic heart // #atimefordirewolves

summary: I read your post about Sandor’s placement in the Gendrya dynamic and I agree with all you said. I was wondering if you had any...
question: I read your post about Sandor’s placement in the Gendrya dynamic and I agree with all you said. I was wondering if you had any idea as to /how/ he’s going to be instrumental in bringing them together?  POSSIBLE SPOILERS:My fear is that we are not going to see a lot of interaction between the Hound and Arya and that they each go in different directions once they reach KL, never to see each other again (i.e. he’ll die in cleganebowl)
answer:
Thank you anon, I bloody hope I’m right anyway! 

To be honest, I don’t think he’s going to have a large conversation about it. The man is of few words. I mean, even when he essentially told Gendry to go and find Arya and tell her how he felt, he was just like “Of course it is you twat.” Doesn’t mince his words does Sandor!

See, I think Cleganebowl is going to be the thing that’s instrumental. Because I think Arya will be present for it. And Sandor will kill Gregor, but either die/require Arya to give him the gift of mercy - and I reckon he’ll say something to trigger her into choosing life (like how Beric’s last word - which was cut, I suspect for not wanting to be so obvious - to Arya was “Live.”). 

This is my dream scenario, but as he’s about to die it wouldn’t massively surprise me if he ended up saying something like “Don’t end up like me. Stop chasing fucking death girl. You have reasons to live.” triggering Arya to cry (we have yet to see the scene which Maisie said was Arya ‘sobbing’. Wouldn’t be surprised if it was connected to the Hound), followed by him saying “That twat loves you. And you’ve loved him for years. Stop being a stubborn cunt and go after him.”

BUT I DUNNO. I reckon it’ll be along those lines, and that’s the dream, but I don’t know. Sandor and Arya will have interactions and I don’t think they’ll just separate at King’s Landing. He’s been placed with Arya (and Gendry) very specifically. That isn’t just about to go away.

reblog.comment:
Thank you anon, I bloody hope I’m right anyway! 

To be honest, I don’t think he’s going to have a large conversation about it. The man is of few words. I mean, even when he essentially told Gendry to go and find Arya and tell her how he felt, he was just like “Of course it is you twat.” Doesn’t mince his words does Sandor!

See, I think Cleganebowl is going to be the thing that’s instrumental. Because I think Arya will be present for it. And Sandor will kill Gregor, but either die/require Arya to give him the gift of mercy - and I reckon he’ll say something to trigger her into choosing life (like how Beric’s last word - which was cut, I suspect for not wanting to be so obvious - to Arya was “Live.”). 

This is my dream scenario, but as he’s about to die it wouldn’t massively surprise me if he ended up saying something like “Don’t end up like me. Stop chasing fucking death girl. Wouldn’t be surprised if it was connected to the Hound), followed by him saying “That twat loves you. And you’ve loved him for years. Stop being a stubborn cunt and go after him.”

BUT I DUNNO. I reckon it’ll be along those lines, and that’s the dream, but I don’t know. Sandor and Arya will have interactions and I don’t think they’ll just separate at King’s Landing. He’s been placed with Arya (and Gendry) very specifically. That isn’t just about to go away.

blog.name: grumpyjonsnow
blog.description: GOT dedicated side blog. Largely Stark centric. I don’t ship ANYONE currently living with Jon. WARNING this blog will have spoilers.

summary: how are you feeling about gendrya rn?
question: how are you feeling about gendrya rn?
answer:
Um, okay, so it’s really hard to make confident predictions of anything when you don’t have a lot of trust in the creators/writers, and that’s making me struggle a bit (though like ngl, I have more trust in D&D then the creators of some other shows I’ve watched -cough-jroth-cough- but that’s not necessarily a high bar). 

That being said, let’s all remember No Featherbed for Me (The Maiden of the Tree, whatever you wanna call it) - I know y’all are all aware AF of it because it’s been a hugely discussed gendrya moments from the books, but let’s just take a little look at the lyrics for a second. 

My featherbed is deep and soft,
and there I’ll lay you down,
I’ll dress you all in yellow silk,
and on your head a crown.
For you shall be my lady love,
and I shall be your lord.
I’ll always keep you warm and safe,
and guard you with my sword.
And how she smiled and how she laughed,
the maiden of the tree.
She spun away and said to him,
no featherbed for me.
I’ll wear a gown of golden leaves,
and bind my hair with grass,
But you can be my forest love,
and me your forest lass.

In it, a man proposes marriage to his love, wanting them to be Lord and Lady, she rejects the proposal & those conventions, but counter offers him. Gendrya’s sex scene was certainly on no featherbed, Gendry has proposed a marriage with them as Lord and Lady at Storm’s End, and Arya has rejected it. All that remains is a counter offer from Arya. 

So while I am fully aware that GOT likes to be dark and tragic, I still have some hope in this area. Their story has played out right along with the song so far, why not the rest of it?

blog.name: bonesgadh
blog.title: Another Arya Stark Stan
blog.description: Just a girl who is obsessed with many things: Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Bones, Pitch Perfect, La La Land, Desperate Housewives, Stranger Things, Friends, HIMYM, Orange Is The New Black, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, The Hunger Games. Cheese addict. Dog lover. Disney and Pixar crazy fan. Pretty decent cook. 🇲🇽. Proud Gryffindor. Broadway Freak. Drummer. I write stuff, mostly fanfiction. Rey Solo theorist. I love all sports. Main ships: Booth & Brennan, Gendrya, Ross & Rachel, Jeca, Everlark, Merder, Mileven, Damerey, Harmione. I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

tags: i hate that yall do this every time in every fandom
summary: I really don’t like that when people fancast aces they always choose the masculine-presenting or gender-ambiguous presenting...
body:
I really don’t like that when people fancast aces they always choose the masculine-presenting or gender-ambiguous presenting female characters.

It’s not Sansa, or Daenerys, or Margaery who are asexual.

It’s Brienne and Arya.

It’s almost like it’s not about have ace rep, it’s about furthering a stereotype that masculine women don’t deserve love or sex, or that if they do experience love or sex it makes them “lesser”. I never saw the amount of bullshit spreading when any of the feminine-presenting characters had sex than what I saw when Arya or Brienne did.
